item.title: Psychedelic Ayahuasca Moves into the Mainstream
item.description:
Psychedelic Ayahuasca Moves into the Mainstream

I grew up with Matt. We went to grade school and high school together - we've been friends for some 27 years. He was always ahead of the curve on drugs. When we were in seventh grade we went to the Eagles' Hell Freezes Over tour: Matt was happily hitting up people our parents' age for tokes as I innocently buried my nose beneath my sweatshirt.

item.title: Ayahuasca Amazon Adventure Icaros
item.description:
Ayahuasca Amazon Adventure Icaros

our third ceremony in the amazon jungle, with pulse adventure tours in Peru. Shaman Wiler Noriega Rodrigues.

item.title: Native American church, known for using peyote and marijuana, to open branches in former O.C. pot shops
item.description:
Native American church, known for using peyote and marijuana, to open branches in former O.C. pot shops

A national Native American church that courts have allowed to possess and distribute peyote will soon open branches in three former Orange County pot shops, where they plan to use and dispense marijuana and other illegal drugs as part of religious ceremonies.

item.title: Church Seeks to Offer 'Vision Quests' Near Elbe
item.description:
Church Seeks to Offer 'Vision Quests' Near Elbe

A new church near Elbe is hoping to facilitate "vision quests" for its members through the sacramental use of hallucinogens. If successful, the church would be the first of its kind open to the public in the United States. Unsurprisingly, that mission has managed to catch the eye of the Lewis County Prosecutor's Office.

item.title: Ayahuasca: the shamanic brew that produces out-of-body experiences
item.description:
Ayahuasca: the shamanic brew that produces out-of-body experiences

Ayahuasca, known by various names by different indigenous groups in South America, is a generic term commonly associated with preparations of the mildly psychoactive vine Banisteriopsis caapi.

item.title: A Closer Look At That "First Legal Ayahuasca Church In America" Story You've Seen Hyped In The Media - Reset.me
item.description:
A Closer Look At That "First Legal Ayahuasca Church In America" Story You've Seen Hyped In The Media - Reset.me

If you were on Facebook or any of the many alternative media outlets that reported it last month, you have probably seen stories stating that taking ayahuasca in a legal "church" setting is now possible here in the United States. But is it true? Is it legal? Is it even a church?

item.title: Marc Shackman on Legal Ayahuasca in America
item.description:
Marc Shackman on Legal Ayahuasca in America

Marc leads the group Ayahuasca Healings out of Washington, USA. They are offering ceremonies with ayahuasca as part of the Native American Church, which anyone can join. We talk about how Marc and his group are approaching the legal situation they find themselves in, as well as the philosophy and practice of 'oneness' and how this pertains to ayahuasca.

item.title: Why Do You See What You See When You're Tripping on Psychedelics? | VICE | United States
item.description:
Why Do You See What You See When You're Tripping on Psychedelics? | VICE | United States

It's a riddle that's lingered as long as humans have been deliberately altering their minds with chemicals, which is to say for all of human history. To crack it, try taking a good look at yourself tripping face, and you'll find that why you're seeing exactly what you're seeing is perhaps just as mind melting as the visuals themselves.
